summary: This document is a series of emails from October 2020 between law enforcement officials (NYPD detective, FBI, and an Assistant U.S. Attorney) discussing the scheduling of an interview with an individual named Mullen and the preparation of an amended search warrant affidavit for drives seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence. It reveals ongoing investigative activity related to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Paul
persons.context: Addressed in an email regarding the review of a draft affidavit for an amended search warrant for drives from Epstein's residence.

persons.name: Mullen
persons.context: An individual whose interview with law enforcement was canceled and is being rescheduled for a later date in the week of October 26, 2020.

connections.description: Paul, as part of the NYPD/FBI task force, is involved in scheduling an interview with Mullen, indicating Mullen is a subject of investigative interest.

events.title: Email coordination on Mullen interview and warrant
events.description: Law enforcement officials exchange emails to reschedule an interview with Mullen and discuss the timing for finalizing an amended search warrant affidavit.

events.title: Draft affidavit submitted for amended warrant
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney sends a draft affidavit in support of an amended search warrant for three drives seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence to a NYPD detective for review.

keyFacts: Investigative activity related to the Epstein case was ongoing as of October 2020, focusing on evidence from his New York residence.
Law enforcement was preparing an amended search warrant affidavit for three drives seized from Epstein's New York home.
An interview with an individual named Mullen was being scheduled by the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force.
The correspondence involves an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York, indicating federal prosecution involvement.
